etymologies: Old English stoc(c) ‘trunk, block of wood, post’, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch stok and German Stock ‘stick’. The notion ‘store, fund’ (stock (sense 1 of the noun and stock sense 2 of the noun)) arose in late Middle English and is of obscure origin, perhaps expressing ‘growth from a central stem’ or ‘firm foundation’

definitions: the goods or merchandise kept on the premises of a business or warehouse and available for sale or distribution

examples.text: the store has a very low turnover of stock
buy now, while stocks last!
stock shortages

shortDefinitions: goods or merchandise kept on premises of shop or warehouse

definitions: a supply or quantity of something accumulated or available for future use

examples.text: I need to replenish my stock of wine
fish stocks are being dangerously depleted

shortDefinitions: supply or quantity of something accumulated or available for future use

definitions: farm animals such as cattle, pigs, and sheep, bred and kept for their meat or milk; livestock

examples.text: all the stock were housed and fed in sheds
the sale of dairy stock

shortDefinitions: farm animals

definitions: photographic film that has not been exposed or processed.
shortDefinitions: photographic film that has not been exposed or processed

definitions: (in some card games) the cards that have not yet been dealt, left on the table to be drawn.
shortDefinitions: (in some card games) cards that have not yet been dealt, left on table

definitions: the capital raised by a business or corporation through the issue and subscription of shares

examples.text: between 1982 and 1986 the value of the company's stock rose by 86%

shortDefinitions: capital raised by company or corporation through issue and subscription of shares

definitions: shares of stock of a particular company as held by an individual or group as an investment

examples.text: she owned $3000 worth of stock

shortDefinitions: portion of company's as held by individual or group as investment

definitions: the shares of a particular company, type of company, or industry

examples.text: blue-chip stocks

shortDefinitions: shares of particular company, type of company

definitions: securities issued by the government in fixed units with a fixed rate of interest

examples.text: government gilt-edged stock

shortDefinitions: (in UK) securities issued by government in fixed units with fixed rate of interest

definitions: a person's reputation or popularity

examples.text: I felt I was right, but my stock was low with this establishment

shortDefinitions: person's reputation or popularity

definitions: liquid made by cooking bones, meat, fish, or vegetables slowly in water, used as a basis for the preparation of soup, gravy, or sauces

examples.text: a pint of chicken stock

shortDefinitions: liquid made by cooking bones, meat, fish, or vegetables slowly in water

definitions: the raw material from which a specified commodity can be manufactured

examples.text: the fat can be used as soap stock

shortDefinitions: raw material from which specified commodity can be manufactured

definitions: a person's ancestry or line of descent

examples.text: her mother was of French stock
both of them came from peasant stock

notes.text: usually with adjective or noun modifier

shortDefinitions: person's ancestry or line of descent

definitions: a breed, variety, or population of an animal or plant

examples.text: the vineyards were plowed up and replanted using different vine stock
geographically separate stocks of some species are recognized

shortDefinitions: breed, variety, or population of animal or plant

definitions: the trunk or woody stem of a living tree or shrub, especially one into which a graft (scion) is inserted.
shortDefinitions: trunk of living tree

definitions: the perennial part of a herbaceous plant, especially a rhizome.
shortDefinitions: perennial part of herbaceous plant

definitions: a herbaceous European plant that is widely cultivated for its fragrant flowers, which are typically lilac, pink, or white.

notes.text: Genus Matthiola, family Brassicaceae: several species

shortDefinitions: herbaceous European plant that is cultivated for its fragrant lilac, pink, or white flowers

definitions: an instrument of punishment consisting of an adjustable wooden structure with holes for securing a person's feet and hands, in which criminals were locked and exposed to public ridicule or assault.
shortDefinitions: instrument of punishment consisting of adjustable wooden structure with holes for securing person's feet and hands

definitions: the part of a rifle or other firearm to which the barrel and firing mechanism are attached, held against one's shoulder when firing the gun.
shortDefinitions: part of rifle or other firearm to which barrel and firing mechanism are attached

definitions: the crosspiece of an anchor.
shortDefinitions: crossbar of anchor

definitions: the handle of something such as a whip or fishing rod.
shortDefinitions: handle of something such as whip or fishing rod

definitions: a band of white material tied like a cravat and worn as a part of formal horse-riding dress.
shortDefinitions: band of white material tied like cravat

definitions: a piece of black material worn under a clerical collar.
shortDefinitions: piece of black material worn under clerical collar

definitions: a frame used to support a ship or boat out of water, especially when under construction.
shortDefinitions: frame used to support ship or boat out of water

definitions: (of a product or type of product) usually kept in stock and thus regularly available for sale

examples.text: 25 percent off stock items

shortDefinitions: (of product or type of product) usually kept in stock and thus regularly available for sale

definitions: (of a phrase or expression) so regularly used as to be automatic or hackneyed

examples.text: “Two weeks” was the stock reply

shortDefinitions: so regularly used as to be automatic or hackneyed

definitions: denoting a conventional character type or situation that recurs in a particular genre of literature, theater, or film

examples.text: the stock characters in every cowboy movie

shortDefinitions: denoting conventional character type or situation that recurs in particular genre of literature or film

definitions: denoting or relating to cinematic footage that can be regularly used in different productions, typically that of outdoor scenes used to add realism to a production shot in an indoor set.
shortDefinitions: denoting or relating to cinematic footage that can be regularly used in different productions

definitions: have or keep a supply of (a particular product or type or product) available for sale

examples.text: most supermarkets now stock a range of organic produce

shortDefinitions: have or keep supply of available for sale

definitions: provide or fill with goods, items, or a supply of something

examples.text: I must stock up the fridge

shortDefinitions: provide or fill with goods, items, or supply of something

definitions: amass supplies of something, typically for a particular occasion or purpose

examples.text: I'm stocking up for Christmas
you'd better stock up with fuel

shortDefinitions: amass supplies of something

definitions: fit (a rifle or other firearm) with a stock

examples.text: it was a fine gun which he forged, stocked, and completed himself

shortDefinitions: fit rifle or other firearm with stock
